jobDescription: Responsibilities: · Provides leadership to the care team regarding appropriate level of care, discharge planning, and outcomes management for quality, best practice guidelines and evidence based medicine.  · Facilitates, coordinates and advocates a comprehensive plan of care to achieve quality while optimizing financial outcomes utilizing knowledge of payer /reimbursement practices and regulations impacting the patient's plan of care and discharge plan.  · Communicate to patient/family, physician and staff members of discharge options and plans and document all plans in the medical record. Requirements: · Current licensure to practice Registered Nursing in the State of Michigan.  · Minimum of three years of recent experience in an acute care setting required.  · Bachelor's in Nursing Required.  · Knowledge or experience in utilization management and/or discharge planning preferred.  · Strong verbal and written communications skills.  · Strong interpersonal skills and ability to build cooperative working relationships with all staff members, patient families, and visitors required.  · Excellent documentation abilities are required to educate physicians, nursing staff and other hospital departments in their documentation process.  · Must have the ability to accomplish duties with frequent interruptions and changes in priorities.  · Must be committed to the continuous improvement of the patient experience which includes patient safety, quality of care and excellent service.
